questions.text: Which of the following Lokdevtas is NOT included in the 'Panch Pirs' of Marwar?
questions.explanation: The Panch Pirs include Ramdevji, Pabuji, Gogaji, Harbhuji, and Mehaji. Teja Ji is a revered Jat deity but not part of the Panch Pirs.

questions.text: Who is worshipped as the 'Deity of Camels' (Oonto ke Devta) in Rajasthan?
questions.explanation: Pabuji is worshipped as the protector of camels. It is believed that he brought camels to Marwar.

questions.text: Which Lokdevta fought against Mahmud Ghaznavi to protect cows?
questions.explanation: Gogaji fought against Mahmud Ghaznavi. Ghaznavi was impressed by his bravery and called him 'Jahar Pir' (Living Saint).

questions.text: Where is the main temple of Baba Ramdevji located, which is famous for the communal harmony fair?
questions.explanation: The main temple is in Runecha (Ramdevra), Jaisalmer. The fair held here is a symbol of Hindu-Muslim unity.

questions.text: Which Lokdevta has the longest and oldest 'Phad' (scroll painting) in Rajasthan?
questions.explanation: Devnarayan Ji's Phad is the longest, oldest, and has the smallest illustrations. A postal stamp was also issued on it.

questions.text: Who is known as the 'Deity with four hands' (Char Haathon Wale Lokdevta) due to his valor during the siege of Chittorgarh?
questions.explanation: Vir Kalla Ji fought with Jaimal on his shoulders during Akbar's attack on Chittorgarh, appearing as a four-armed deity.

questions.text: Which Lokdevta composed the literary work 'Choubis Baniya'?
questions.explanation: Baba Ramdevji was also a poet. He composed 'Choubis Baniya' which contains his teachings.

questions.text: Teja Ji is mainly worshipped to seek protection from:
questions.explanation: Teja Ji is known as 'Kala-Bala ka Devta' and is worshipped for protection against snake bites and for the well-being of livestock.

questions.text: The main shrine of Mehaji Mangaliya is located in which village of Jodhpur?
questions.explanation: The main temple of Mehaji Mangaliya, one of the Panch Pirs, is located in Bapini village, Jodhpur.

questions.text: What is the vehicle (Vahan) of the Lokdevta Harbhuji Sankhla?
questions.explanation: Harbhuji's vehicle is a Jackal (Siyar). He was a cousin of Ramdevji and a master of shakun shastra.
